title: AEK - Boco FC handed cash boost to develop girls team
body_text:
A youth football club in Bristol has been given a cash boost by a housing company.
Persimmon Homes Severn Valley has donated £930 to AEK-Boco FC under-11s girls team to help the club give more opportunities to young female players.
The donation has helped fund a new kit for the team.
The club was formed in 2003 following the merger of AEK Rangers and Boco Juniors, and almost 500 children are signed on to the club.
There are teams across the youth section from under-fives/under-sixes to under-18s.
They play in the Hanham Minor, Avon Youth, and Bristol Girls League.
Carly Spear, sales director at Persimmon Homes Severn Valley, said: "Persimmon’s Community Champions scheme is all about supporting great initiatives in the areas where we build.
"We’re proud to back AEK-Boco FC, especially as they work hard to widen access to football for young girls.
"With women’s football continuing to inspire the next generation, this donation will help ensure those opportunities are available locally."
The cash boost is part of Persimmon's Community Champions scheme, which sees the housing company support causes across Britain.
Recent local recipients include Ashton & Backwell United FC, Backwell Playhouse, and Nailsea & Backwell RFC.
AEK-Boco U11 girls' team manager, Ben White, said: "We’re delighted to receive this support from Persimmon.
"This funding will help us provide the equipment and facilities needed to give every player the best experience possible."
